 If there is congruence between reading in control room and indicator on plant, take down signal protocol for the faulty transmitter.

column4: Blockage in Z102 OR Blocked Line Downstream of SOV125
column5:
Switch J100 control mode to manual and decrease J100 pump speed to 5%. Simultaneously monitor PT104. If it continues to spike, cut J100. 
Open V120. Then close V117a and V117b. 
Check SOV125, V402 and V403 are open
Monitor PT104. If PT104 is <2 bar, increase J100 speed sequentially in 5% steps to return to steady state operation

Switch J100 control mode to manual and decrease J100 pump speed to 5%. Simultaneously monitor PT104. If it continues to spike, cut J100. Open V120. Then close V117a and V117b. Check SOV125, V402 and V403 are open. Monitor PT104. If PT104 is <2 bar, increase J100 speed sequentially in 5% steps to return to steady state operation

column4: Blocked line between V116 and SOV125
column5: Switch J100 control mode to manual and decrease J100 pump speed to 5%. Simultaneously monitor PT104. If it continues to spike, cut J100. Check V116, V117a, V117b, V121 are open
Switch J100 control mode to manual and decrease J100 pump speed to 5%. Simultaneously monitor PT104. If it continues to spike, cut J100. Check V112, V113a, V113b are open
Check SOV123, V119a, V119b, V198a, V198b, V124, V315 and all stripper sample valves are closed and not visibly damaged. Check plant for visible MEA leakage
Check V109, V111, V168, V115, V118, V122, V153, V154, NRV106, RV101, V107 and V108 and all stripper sample valves are closed and not visibly damaged. Check plant for visible MEA leakage
Check line for visible leaks. Attempt to locate the leak Refer to leak SOP.
Shift J100 to manual control mode and decrease J100 speed in 5% steps down to zero. Check TT106 for pump overheat, and inspect J100 for damages
Shift J100 to manual control mode and decrease J100 speed in 5% steps down. Monitor PT104, FT103, FT104 for continued anomalies. Adjust control parameters as required
